      • getDepPlanRoot

        public static org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Package getDepPlanRoot(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element element)
        Return the package in which deployment plans are stored. Caveat: needs to be executed within a transition, since the deployment plan package will be created, if it does not exist yet.
        Parameters:
        element - an arbitrary element of the source model (i.e. the model that will store the deployment plan
        Returns:
        package in which deployment plans are stored

        Automatically choose an implementation, i.e. choose the first implementation within the component model that implements a given component type.

      • configureProperty

        public static void configureProperty(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification instance,
                                     org.eclipse.emf.ecore.ENamedElement property,
                                     String value)
        Configure an attribute of an instance specification
        Parameters:
        instance - the instance specification
        property - An ENamedElement denoting the name of an attribute of a classifier that is in the classifier list of the instance specification
        value - the string value. An enumeration can be configured via the name of the literal

        Parameters:

        propertyName - the name of an attribute of a classifier that is in the classifier list of the instance specification

      • configureProperty

        public static void configureProperty(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification instance,
                                     org.eclipse.emf.ecore.ENamedElement property,
                                     org.eclipse.emf.common.util.Enumerator value)
        Convenience function: allow that an ECore named element is passed instead of a property name. This is useful if the parameter that should be configured stems from a static profile
        Parameters:
        instance - The instance of which an attribute should be configured.
        property - The name of the property (denoted by an ENamedElement) that should be configured
        value - its value in form of an element of an ECore enumerator value

      • configureProperty

        public static void configureProperty(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification instance,
                                     String propertyName,
                                     org.eclipse.emf.common.util.Enumerator value)
        Configure a property for an enumeration. Enumerations are a bit difficult to handle, since the enumeration literal itself must be created first in form of an instance specification
        Parameters:
        instance - The instance of which an attribute should be configured.
        propertyName - The name of the property that should be configured
        value - its value in form of an element of an ECore enumerator value

      • configureEnumProperty

        public static void configureEnumProperty(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification instance,
                                         String propertyName,
                                         String literalName)
        Configure a property for an enumeration. Enumerations are a bit difficult to handle, since the enumeration literal itself must be created first in form of an instance specification.
        Parameters:
        instance - The instance of which an attribute should be configured.
        propertyName - The name of the property that should be configured
        value - its value in form of an String. The function does nothing, if no literal corresponds to the passed String

      • configureEnumProperty

        public static void configureEnumProperty(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification instance,
                                         org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Property attribute,
                                         String literalName)

      • updateInstanceNames

        public static void updateInstanceNames(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification instance,
                                       String name)
        Update the names of instances within a deployment plan to correspond to changes in the hierarchy. In particular, flattening of interaction components requires this update.
        Parameters:
        composite - System composite
